thread.title: Norwegian to send newest, hottest ship to China
thread.title_full: Norwegian to send newest, hottest ship to China

title: Norwegian to send newest, hottest ship to China
text:
An artist's drawing of a new ship that Norwegian Cruise Line is building for the China market. (Photo: Norwegian Cruise Line)
17 CONNECT 15 TWEET 4 LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Add Norwegian to the list of cruise companies sending their newest, hottest ships to China.
The Miami-based line today revealed that a 4,200-passenger vessel it has on order for delivery in 2017 will be devoted to Chinese travelers instead of North Americans.
Currently under construction at the Meyer Werft shipyard in Germany, the as-yet-unnamed, 164,400-ton vessel will feature accommodations, cuisine and on-board experiences that cater specifically to the preferences of Chinese travelers, the line said. It'll be based at a China port to be named later.
“Our new purpose-built ship for China will have characteristics that are authentic to Norwegian Cruise Line and yet distinctively Chinese in all of its sensibility,” Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings CEO Frank Del Rio said in a statement accompanying the announcement.
USA TODAY
Sign of the times? Next Princess Cruises ship to be called 盛世公主号
Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings ( NCLH ) is the parent company of Norwegian as well as Oceania Cruises and Regent Seven Seas Cruises.
The announcement comes as rivals Royal Caribbean and Princess are in the midst of deploying their latest ships to China. Royal Caribbean just moved its one-year-old, 4,180-passenger Quantum of the Seas to Shanghai year-round to serve the Chinese market and will send a second new vessel to China in 2016. Princess plans to send its next new ship to China in 2017.
The moves are a blow to North American cruisers who are accustomed to getting the latest ships from North America-based lines in their home markets. But the industry increasingly is looking to Asia for growth, and a growing number of lines are concluding the secret to success in the region is in the deployment of new vessels.
Among other lines shifting capacity to Asia to target local markets are Costa Cruises, which has been expanding rapidly in China. Princess also has been expanding in Japan with cruises aimed at the local market.
The ship Norwegian is sending to China will be based on the design of the line's soon-to-debut Norwegian Escape -- the largest Norwegian ship ever. For a sneak peek inside the vessel, which will be christened in November, scroll through our 'first look' tour in the carousel below.
Norwegian Cruise Line's next ship, the 4,200-passenger Norwegian Escape, is nearing completion at the Meyer Werft shipyard in Papenburg, Germany. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Scheduled to debut in October 2015, Norwegian Escape will be the largest vessel ever for Norwegian Cruise Line at 164,400 tons. It'll be the fifth largest cruise ship ever built by any line. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape features maritime-themed hull art designed by marine artist Guy Harvey. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's top deck (shown here nearing completion on Sept. 15, 2015) is home to the Aqua Park, a family-friendly fun zone that harbors five water slides. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 16, the Aqua Park has a pool and a watery play area for small children. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Aqua Park features Free Fall, billed as the fastest water slide at sea, and another slide that takes inner tubes designed for two -- a first for Norwegian. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The water slide zone atop the Norwegian Escape will include a watery play area for children called the Kid's Aqua Park. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The hub of the Norwegian Escape's top decks is its main pool area, located on Deck 16. Its layout differs from recent Norwegian ships, featuring a double-decker bar and more room for lounge chairs. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In another new twist, the Norwegian Escape has two large outdoor screens overlooking the main pool on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Two large hot tubs flank the main pool on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen As on the recently unveiled Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, most of Norwegian Escape's interior public areas are spread across Decks 6, 7 and 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 6, Taste restaurant (shown here nearing completion) is one of several eateries available to passengers at no extra charge. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Among differences between the Norwegian Escape and the Norwegian Getaway is an expanded bar area at the Headliners Comedy Club on Deck 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like the Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, Norwegian Escape has a large Teppanyaki restaurant on Deck 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also returning on Norwegian Escape is Norwegian's signature French restaurant e Bistro. Seen here nearing completion, it's located on Deck 6 in the same space as on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Spreading between Decks 6 and 7, the Norwegian Escape's centrally located Atrium is wider than its sister spaces on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway (the entire ship is about two meters wider, allowing for a number of larger venues). Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located just off the Atrium on Deck 6 is the Cafe at the Atrium, which will serve extra-charge specialty coffees and pastries from Carlo's Bake Shop. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Library is tucked into a nook on deck 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Supper Club on Deck 6. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The configuration of the Supper Club is different on the Norwegian Escape as compared to recent ships with the stage across from the entrance and tiered seating. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's main showroom, the Escape Theater, holds 900 passengers -- about 150 more than the main theaters on the Norwegian Breakaway and Norwegian Getaway. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Unlike on earlier Norwegian ships, the Escape's theater has a full bar at its back with seating. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen More bar seats are located across from the Escape Theater bar facing the stage. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like Norwegian's last few ships, the Norwegian Escape will have an O'Sheehan's Pub, located on Deck 7 overlooking the Atrium. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The bar at O'Sheehan's. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 7, the Escape Casino spills into the main corridor. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A giant chandelier illuminates a three-deck high opening spanning decks 6, 7 and 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Escape Casino is larger than the casinos on Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway, spilling into space previously used for an Asian noodle bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New on Norwegian Escape is the Skyline Bar, located adjacent to the ship's casino on Deck 7. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Skyline Bar is located in space that is home to a disco on earlier Norwegian ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A plush seating area taking shape in the Skyline Bar on the soon-to-debut Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The aft portion of Deck 8 on the Norwegian Escape is home to a large duty free shopping area. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Called Tradewinds, the duty free shopping area on the Norwegian Escape will stock a wide range of jewelry, perfume, clothing and more. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A Columbia Emeralds corner will be among the highlights of the Tradewinds duty free shopping area on Deck 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The shopping area on the Norwegian Escape also will have an area dedicated to merchandise from marine artist Guy Harvey, who designed the ship's hull art. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In a change from recent Norwegian ships, shopping stands have been designed into the sides of the corridor on Deck 8 instead of in the middle, improving traffic flow. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen This still-under-construction space on Deck 8 will be home to the first Lacoste boutique at sea. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on the Norwegian Escape will be The Cellars, A Michael Mondavi Wine Bar -- Norwegian's first wine bar at sea. It'll take the place of the Ice Bar found on recent Norwegian ships. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Cellars will serve Mondavi wines by the glass in a stylish setting. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape will feature celebrity chef's Jose Garces' first restaurant at sea, a Cuban eatery called Bayamo by Jose Garces. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 8, Bayamo by Jose Garces will be one of two eateries by the celebrity chef on the Norwegian Escape. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Deck 8 also will be home to the Pincho Tapas Bar by Jose Garces -- a first for Norwegian Cruise Line. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Also new on Norwegian Escape will be Tobacco Road, a re-creation of Miami's oldest bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The La Cucina Italian eatery found on previous Norwegian ship will return on Norwegian Escape on Deck 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The 5 O'Clock Somewhere Bar on Deck 8. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape will have the line's first craft beer-focused outpost, called the District Brew House. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 8, the District Brew House will have 25 beers on tap and another 50 available in bottles. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Another new concept for Norwegian on the Norwegian Escape will be Food Republic, a casual eatery with a mix of cuisines including sushi available from four stations. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's still-under-construction Fitness Center on Deck 16 will have floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the ocean. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape's Mandara Spa is located at the front of the ship on Deck 16. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A barber shop is part of the Mandara Spa complex. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen At the back of Deck 16 is Norwegian Escape's casual buffet eatery, the Garden Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Nearing completion, the Garden Cafe is wider than those on recent Norwegian ships and has a new configuration with more seating. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A food serving area in the Garden Cafe. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Nine holes of miniature golf is among the attractions at the Sports Complex at the back of the Norwegian Escape on Deck 18. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The Norwegian Escape will feature the largest ropes course at sea, located at the back of the ship on Deck. 18. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen New for Norwegian Cruise Line on the Norwegian Escape will be a bocce court, shown here nearing completion. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Returning on the Norwegian Escape is The Plank, a popular feature of the Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway. In fact, this ship has two of them. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Entourage will be home to dance parties, video games, art, movies and other activities geared to teens. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located on Deck 17, Entourage is a lounge on the Norwegian Escape dedicated exclusively to teens. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Located at the back of Deck 17 is Spice H2O, an adult-only outdoor retreat with lounge chairs, hot tubs and a waterfall grotto. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen The adult-only Spice H2O area comes with its own bar. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen A hot tub at the adult-only Spice H2O zone. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen In a difference with the adult-only Spice H20 areas found on recent Norwegian ships, the Norwegian Escape's version of the space will have a watery grotto where passengers can cool off. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Norwegian Escape is one deck taller than the recently unveiled Norwegian Getaway and Norwegian Breakaway and also about six feet wider. Gene Sloan, USA TODAY Fullscreen Like this topic?
